entry.title: Migrating To Octopress
entry.content:
Finally I have moved to Octopress from blogger and this is my first Octopress post. I think this is very cool since it uses markdown so I can write my post anywhere, using any text editor. Plain text means lightweight and fast. Next, I want to learn how to change the template and layout.

Testing the markdown syntax on octopress:

Headers

This is H1

This is H2

This is H3

This is H4

This is H5
This is H6

Lists

Ordered List

  1. Item number1
  2. Item number2
  3. Item number3

Unordered List

  • Item 1
  • Item 2
  • Item 3

List with paragraph

  1. Item 1

Lorem ipsum lorem ipsum Lorem ipsum lorem ipsum Lorem ipsum lorem ipsum Lorem ipsum lorem ipsum Lorem ipsum lorem ipsum Lorem ipsum lorem ipsum Lorem ipsum lorem ipsum Lorem ipsum lorem ipsum Lorem ipsum lorem ipsum Lorem ipsum lorem ipsumLorem ipsum lorem ipsum.

  1. Item 2

Lorem ipsum lorem ipsum Lorem ipsum lorem ipsum Lorem ipsum lorem ipsum Lorem ipsum lorem ipsum Lorem ipsum lorem ipsum Lorem ipsum lorem ipsum Lorem ipsum lorem ipsum Lorem ipsum lorem ipsum Lorem ipsum lorem ipsum Lorem ipsum lorem ipsumLorem ipsum lorem ipsum.

Tables

Tables Are Cool
col 3 is right-aligned $1600 |
col 2 is centered $12 |
zebra stripes are neat $1 |

It seems octopress does not support tables rendering by default

Bold, Italics and Strikethrough

This is italics This is bold This is bold and italics This is strikethrough

Is there no underlines?

Links

Go to google.com

Go to home page of this site

This is reference-style link

Later link text

Code with syntax highlighting

``` java public class TestClass {

public static void main(String[] args) {
    System.out.println("Hellooooooo");
}

} ```

Blockquotes

This is blockquotes

Horizontal Rule
